result.execSummary:
The defendant Christie Ernest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month and each month thereafter commencing 7/1/16 or penalty of 4 days Huber, consecutive for non-payment.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentence credit of 4 days granted. Time Served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christie Ernest

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christie Ernest in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #3.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #3. 

Sentence of:
4 days jail.  (Credit 4 days).  TIME SERVED.
COSTS:  $243.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 7/1/2016. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 4 days in Huber
Received May 20, 2016,   State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christie Ernest in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christie Ernest in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is waiting on a counteroffer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Christie Ernest did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
to appear
Hearing at 03-14-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Christie Ernest in court with attorney Kelsey Morin for Cameron Weitzner.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Next date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 02-11-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Christie Ernest in court with attorney Adam Schleis for Cameron Weitzner.   David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is waiting on discovery. Next hearing date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 01-11-2016 02:30 pm

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Christie Ernest in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
